text: Solve this problem step by step.
End with 'DONE.' when you have a solution.
Question: A man lives on the 10th floor of an apartment building.
Every morning he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
When he returns in the evening, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and walks up the stairs for the remaining three floors to reach his apartment.
However, on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.

Why does he only take the elevator to the 7th floor on non-rainy days? 

 Solution: 
<think>
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out why this man takes the elevator only to the 7th floor on non-rainy days.
Let's break this down step by step.
First, the man lives on the 10th floor.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor, which is the 1st floor.
So that's a drop of 9 floors.
In the evening, when he returns, he takes the elevator up to the 7th floor and then walks up the remaining 3 floors to his apartment.
On rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way back up to the 10th floor.
Hmm, why wouldn't he just take the elevator all the way up on non-rainy days? Maybe there's something about the elevator's behavior that makes him prefer stopping at the 7th floor on dry days.
Let me think about elevators.
They usually go up and down, right? But maybe there's a limit to how high or low they go.
Perhaps the elevator doesn't go beyond the 7th floor on non-rainy days.
That would explain why he can't take it all the way to the 10th floor.
So, on rainy days, the elevator can go higher, maybe because it's not restricted, or perhaps the weather affects the elevator's operation.
Wait, another angle: maybe the man has a limited number of floors he can take the elevator on non-rainy days.
If the elevator only goes up to the 7th floor, he has to walk the rest.
But on rainy days, the elevator can go all the way.
So perhaps the building has a rule where the elevator doesn't go above the 7th floor during non-rainy times, or it's programmed that way.
Or maybe the man is trying to save time or avoid waiting for the elevator on non-rainy days by taking it only partway.
Alternatively, maybe the elevator is out of order above the 7th floor on non-rainy days, so he can't go higher.
But the problem doesn't mention that.
It's more likely a rule or a policy in the building.
So, the man takes the elevator to the 7th floor because that's the maximum it goes on non-rainy days, and then he walks up the remaining 3 floors.
On rainy days, the elevator can go all the way, maybe because it's allowed or it's working differently.

So, putting it all together, the man takes the elevator only to the 7th floor on non-rainy days because the elevator doesn't go higher than that in those conditions, perhaps due to a building rule or limitation.
On rainy days, the elevator can go all the way to the 10th floor, so he takes it the entire way.

</think>

The man takes the elevator only to the 7th floor on non-rainy days because the elevator in the building is limited to the 7th floor during those times.
On rainy days, the elevator can go all the way to the 10th floor, allowing him to take it the entire way up.
